item.description:
@ 18 miles
2,850 feet elevation gain
booktime of 10:25 excluding stops
goal time of 9 hours or less including stops

Dogs are welcome!

We will meet at the Lincoln Woods parking area at 8:15 AM and will be crossing the bridge to the Wilderness trail promptly at 8:30 AM. We plan to warm up by jogging the first 2.6 miles to the Black Pond trail which we will follow to the pond. From there we will bushwhack to the Lincoln Brook trail. We will decide on the actual route to the summit once we see what the conditions are.



This will be a fast paced hike with limited stops!

There will be 2 or more bushwhacks during the hike.

If this hike interests you, you may also want to join us on Sunday for a trip to Mt Isolation.

**** Special Notes ****
We may find Winter conditions. It is your responsibility be knowledgeble on the planned route, use of map and compass, and proper gear. This event is strenuous in nature. Traction devices such as Microspikes or crampons are recommended. Snowshoes are recommended. Please arrive early and be ready to ascend at the specified time.

If you have any questions please ask. DO NOT assume anything.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be in a green Suburban with ROT & VFTT decals
item.name: Owls Head - Advanced due to distance & pace
